author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
The Pune police on Monday filed a charge sheet against 35 students of the Film and Television Institute of India for holding institute Director Prashant Pathrabe ‘hostage’ in his cabin for several hours in August last year.

However, all were granted bail. While five had been given bail earlier, the remaining 30 were given bail today.

“There are 35 students against whom the charge sheet has been filed. Five of them, arrested on the intervening night of August 18-19, have been released on bail earlier. 30 students, including 12 who were out on anticipatory bail, were given regular bail,” Defense Counsel Shrikant Shivade said.

Mr. Shivade moved a bail plea for the 30 students in the court of first class judicial magistrate S.S. Bangad, who granted bail to all of them on a personal bond of Rs. 3,000 each.
title: Charge sheet filed against FTII students
